title: Derivative of a function defined as a integral

content.question: Let <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> </mrow> </mstyle></mrow> </math>. At how many points in the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>,</mo> <msqrt> <mi>π</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <mo>]</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> does the instantaneous rate of change of f equal the average rate of change of f on that interval?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
